message_1: A sample of a radioactive material has an initial mass of 100 grams and a half-life of 10 days. Find the mass of the material after 30 days.
message_2:
To find the mass of the radioactive material after 30 days, we can use the formula:

Final mass = Initial mass * (1/2)^(time elapsed / half-life)

In this case, the initial mass is 100 grams, the half-life is 10 days, and the time elapsed is 30 days. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Final mass = 100 * (1/2)^(30 / 10)

Final mass = 100 * (1/2)^3

Final mass = 100 * (1/8)

Final mass = 12.5 grams

So, after 30 days, the mass of the radioactive material will be 12.5 grams.
